references.paper_title: Computable bounds for geometric convergence rates of Markov chains
references.reason: This paper is foundational for convergence rate analysis of Markov chains, introducing the drift and minorization conditions widely used in subsequent work.

references.paper_title: Minorization conditions and convergence rates for Markov chain Monte Carlo
references.reason: This paper significantly advanced the understanding of convergence rates, providing practical tools and insights applicable to various Markov chain settings.

references.paper_title: Renewal theory and computable convergence rates for geometrically ergodic Markov chains
references.reason: This paper provides a valuable framework for computing convergence rates, offering methods to quantify the speed of convergence in various Markov chain contexts.

references.paper_title: Practical drift conditions for subgeometric rates of convergence
references.reason: This paper contributes significantly to the practical applicability of drift condition-based convergence analysis by providing more easily verifiable conditions.

references.paper_title: Quantitative bounds of convergence for geometrically ergodic Markov chains in the Wasserstein distance with application to the Metropolis adjusted Langevin algorithm
references.reason: This paper provides valuable quantitative bounds for convergence in the Wasserstein metric, a crucial distance measure in machine learning and stochastic optimization.
